title.value: Quantifying neurodegeneration of the cervical cord and brain in degenerative cervical myelopathy: A multicentre study using quantitative magnetic resonance imaging
title.justification: The title clearly states the focus of the study on neurodegeneration in the cervical cord and brain in the context of degenerative cervical myelopathy, using quantitative MRI within a multicentre framework.
title.quote: Quantifying neurodegeneration of the cervical cord and brain in degenerative cervical myelopathy: A multicentre study using quantitative magnetic resonance imaging

extractions.description: This research paper investigates the simultaneous assessment of neurodegeneration in the cervical cord and brain in patients with degenerative cervical myelopathy using quantitative magnetic resonance imaging across multiple centres. The study aims to identify microstructural changes associated with clinical impairments and explores the correlation between remote neurodegeneration and sensory deficits.

type.justification: The study is empirical as it involves the collection and analysis of quantitative data from MRI imaging to understand the microstructural changes in patients with DCM, as well as statistical analysis to correlate these changes with sensory impairments.
type.quote: We applied voxelwise analysis with a probabilistic brain/spinal cord template embedded in statistical parametric mapping (SPM-­BSC) to process multi parametric mapping (MPM)... Regression analysis was conducted to establish associations between neurodegeneration and clinical impairment.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on understanding neurological conditions, specifically degenerative cervical myelopathy, through neuroimaging techniques.
name.quote: Simultaneous assessment of neurodegeneration in both the cervical cord and brain across multiple centres can enhance the effectiveness of clinical trials.

name.justification: The study relies heavily on quantitative magnetic resonance imaging (qMRI) techniques to assess neurodegeneration.
name.quote: This study aims to simultaneously assess microstructural changes ... using quantitative magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) in a multicentre study.

name.justification: The paper addresses the neurodegeneration associated with degenerative cervical myelopathy.
name.quote: Simultaneous assessment of the spinal cord and brain revealed DCM-­induced demyelination, iron deposition, and atrophy.

name.justification: The paper references the use of the PAM50 spinal cord template for segmentation and normalization tasks.
name.quote: Next, the total spinal cord area was segmented and normalized to the T2-­weighted PAM50 spinal cord template [27] in Spinal Cord Toolbox software (v3.2.2).

referenced_paper_title.value: PAM50: unbiased multimodal template of the brainstem and spinal cord aligned with the ICBM152 space
referenced_paper_title.justification: The PAM50 template is cited in the context of spinal cord data normalization and alignment.
referenced_paper_title.quote: PAM50: unbiased multimodal template of the brainstem and spinal cord aligned with the ICBM152 space.

name.justification: SPM-12 is used in this study for voxelwise analysis and image processing in the framework of MRI data analysis.
name.quote: The voxel-based morphometry and MPM analysis in SPM-12 (v7219, MATLAB 2019b) were extended to include cervical spinal cord by incorporating a probabilistic atlas of the brain and neck.

referenced_paper_title.value: A fast diffeomorphic image registration algorithm
referenced_paper_title.justification: SPM algorithms are commonly referenced for their statistical parametric mapping methodologies.
referenced_paper_title.quote: A fast diffeomorphic image registration algorithm.

name.justification: SPM is employed for statistical parametric mapping and voxelbased morphometry in MRI analyses.
name.quote: We applied voxelwise analysis with a probabilistic brain/spinal cord template embedded in statistical parametric mapping (SPM-­BSC)...

referenced_paper_title.value: A fast diffeomorphic image registration algorithm
referenced_paper_title.justification: SPM tools are well-documented in scientific research for their use in MRI data analysis.
referenced_paper_title.quote: A fast diffeomorphic image registration algorithm.

name.justification: The Spinal Cord Toolbox is mentioned as being used for image processing tasks like segmentation and template normalization.
name.quote: Next, the total spinal cord area was segmented and normalized... in Spinal Cord Toolbox software (v3.2.2).

referenced_paper_title.value: SCT: spinal cord toolbox, an open-source software for processing spinal cord MRI data
referenced_paper_title.justification: The toolbox is cited in relation to its use in spinal cord MRI data processing.
referenced_paper_title.quote: SCT: spinal cord toolbox, an open-source software for processing spinal cord MRI data.

name.justification: The hMRI toolbox was used for generating quantitative maps from MRI data, emphasizing its role in MRI histogram analysis.
name.quote: The voxel-based microstructural assessment was based on the MT, longitudinal relaxation rate (R1), and effective transverse relaxation rate (R2*) quantitative maps derived from MPM images using the hMRI (histology MRI) toolbox.

referenced_paper_title.value: hMRI – a toolbox for quantitative MRI in neuroscience and clinical research
referenced_paper_title.justification: The use of the hMRI toolbox in quantitative MRI analysis and its functional role is explicitly cited.
referenced_paper_title.quote: hMRI – a toolbox for quantitative MRI in neuroscience and clinical research.
